hints.content: To divide a shape in half, we divide the whole into **$2$ equal parts**.

This circle is divided into $4$ equal pieces:  

![A circle has two lines passing through the center dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/255991878292eece7058378c673fe91f18a2dfcd)

This circle is divided into $2$ pieces, but the pieces are not equal in size:  

![A circle has a line that does not pass through the center dividing it into 2 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/56c754cd9878e09d591ba74274a6fad0ce021e6b)

These circles are divided into halves:  

![2 circles. Each one is divided into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1cf4eb548314de1ca46239b30c74d2204b775d03) ![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b74a74128cec3ef491aba4237553ca8c9122d943)

question.content:
**Which circles are divided into halves?**

choices.content: ![A circle is divided into 3 unequal parts. 2 parts are almost half the circle. The third part is a very small section.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/27c324ac39dfee259f0d22a03caeb1050dd53b0d)
![A circle has a line passing through the center dividing it into 2 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1cf4eb548314de1ca46239b30c74d2204b775d03)
![A circle has a line passing through the center dividing it into 2 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b74a74128cec3ef491aba4237553ca8c9122d943)
![A circle has a line that does not pass through the center dividing it into 2 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/56c754cd9878e09d591ba74274a6fad0ce021e6b)
